name: Yallaiah Onteru
title: Senior Frontend Engineer
professional_summary: Built responsive web applications using React.js, ensuring cross-browser compatibility and accessibility, which improved user engagement by roughly 30%.
Developed reusable UI components with React and styled them using CSS3, reducing development time by around 25%.
Integrated RESTful APIs into React applications, handling asynchronous data fetching and error management efficiently.
Implemented state management using Redux and Context API, improving application performance and maintainability.
Collaborated with backend teams to define API contracts and ensure seamless data flow between frontend and backend systems.
Conducted code reviews and provided constructive feedback to team members, enhancing code quality and consistency.
Utilized Webpack and Babel to bundle and transpile code, optimizing application load times.
Implemented unit tests using Jest and React Testing Library, achieving roughly 90% test coverage for critical components.
Worked with Git for version control, managing branches and resolving merge conflicts effectively.
Optimized React components for performance using memoization and lazy loading techniques, reducing initial load time by around 40%.
Participated in agile ceremonies, including sprint planning, daily stand-ups, and retrospectives, ensuring timely delivery of features.
Mentored junior developers, helping them understand React best practices and project workflows.
Implemented responsive designs using HTML5 and CSS3, ensuring applications worked seamlessly across devices.
Integrated GraphQL APIs into React applications, improving data fetching efficiency and reducing over-fetching issues.
Used TypeScript to enhance code reliability and maintainability, catching type-related errors early in the development process.
Set up CI/CD pipelines using GitHub Actions, automating testing and deployment processes.
Collaborated with designers to translate wireframes and mockups into functional, responsive web pages.
Troubleshot and debugged complex frontend issues, improving application stability and user experience.
